explanation: The report is correct. The call memset(block, 0, block_size) only has assertions that block_offset <= pool->size and pool->size >= block_size, but those do not guarantee block_offset + block_size <= pool->size. In the example (pool->size == 100, block_offset == 90, block_size == 20) memset writes past pool->memory + pool->size. Since mhd_assert is typically a debug-only check (and can be compiled out), there is no guaranteed runtime check preventing out-of-bounds access. That violates MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17 (string.h usage must not access beyond the bounds of the referenced object).
